entry.title: [Media Router] Enable system audio mirroring to audio devices.
entry.content:
This CL enables desktop audio to be mirrored to audio Cast receivers.

It is shipped behind a default-enabled feature,

kCastLoopbackAudioToAudioReceivers.



To correctly offer system audio casting across platforms, some

refactoring was done to share the logic for loopback audio capture

availability between the desktop media picker and the Cast code.

entry.title: [iOS] Fix images swapping in sharing status view
entry.content:
Currently: Sender image is above recipient and it's hidden at the

beginning and visible at the beginning of the animation making it look

like they are swapping.



Intended state: Recipient image is above sender at the beginning and

below it at the end of the animation.



This CL:

* Modifies animation to rely on images centerX constraints instead of

modifying their centers (this messes up when the view layouts again)

* Adds animation subviews in correct order with addSubview instead of

using insertSubview

* Does not hide sender image anymore (it will be below recipient

anyway when they're in the same position at start)

* Adds reordering recipient and sender image later in animation.



Bug: 1463882

Change-Id: I7db0510dd7e2dddc4dd3c345ad35318f58199870

entry.title: Add field type parsing regex for parsing of Adresszusatz.
entry.content:
The CL adds a regular expression to add support for field type parsing

of "Adresszusatz" into ADDRESS_HOME_OVERFLOW.



Note that in the current state, this CL does not affect any users

(except users in Brazil and Mexico who visit German websites).



Field type parsing support is only complete once

i18n_model_definition::IsTypeEnabledForCountry() finds a launched

country model that supports this type. A model for countries that

primarily speak German is not yet in place.

entry.title: Revert "Don't enumerate Vulkan WebGPU adapters if Vulkan is blocked"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 2b0344d84e079c334e6ca5607a4a311e3837f923.



Reason for revert: Breaks testing of WebGPU on Pixel4.



Original change's description:

> Don't enumerate Vulkan WebGPU adapters if Vulkan is blocked

>

> On some devices we are seeing that even enumerating the available

> Vulkan adapters is causing crashes. But these devices are also

> already blocked from using Vulkan for other uses, like Skia. This

> CL uses the same feature check to prevent Vulkan-backed WebGPU

> adapters from being initialized.

part of the cursor is offscreen. Now the cursor bounds are

entry.title: Use ViewsTestBase in InkDropImpl test fixtures.
entry.content:
This CL

- Replaces testing::Test by ViewsTestBase as the base class for the

test fixtures. Doing so allows a) getting rid of

TestSimpleTaskRunner in favor of TaskEnvironment and b) provides

an easy way of attaching the InkDropHostImpl to a Widget.

The latter is the motivation behind this change: Currently, there is

a single caller of View::SetNativeThemeForTesting, namely the

RippleAndHighlightRecreatedOnHostThemeChange test. By attaching the

InkDropHostImpl to a Widget, we can set the testing theme on the

Widget instead and remove the method from the View. This will happen

on a follow-up CL.

- Inlines test fixtures methods and eliminates a test api member, since

it can always be created on the fly.



Bug: 1469136

entry.title: cellular: Update eSIM usage metrics conditions
entry.content:
This change updates the eSIM feature usage classes to consider both the

information known to Hermes as well as the information known to Shill

when determining the eligibility / accessibility / enablement and the

usage of eSIM for both the consumer and enterprise use cases. We need

to consider both Hermes and Shill since there can be situations where

one is readily available but the other is not (e.g. Hermes is still

starting up).



Bug: b/315973656

Test: Unit tests and verified on DUT.

entry.title: Fix the blink_perf.layout regression
entry.content:
Since some fonts may have appearance information in the upper 16 bits

(for example for "Times Roman" traits = (1 << 28) and for "Helvetica"

traits = (1 << 30)), therefore the traits of these fonts may not match,

and we will try to find the better match by increasing the number of

`CreateCopyWithTraitsAndWeightFromFont` calls, compare [0].



This CL changes the condition for style matching to only check the style

traits we care about. This should fix the perf regression, compare the

pinpoint run [1].



[0] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/fonts/mac/font_cache_mac.mm;l=191;drc=7778198165833ef0890951838a87e31498637048

[1] https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/122b03862e0000



Bug: 1019112, 1515324

Change-Id: Icc29a71c8de4969937f130c73f0f4de07e68415d

entry.title: [DownloadBubble] Remove IPH promo for download toolbar button
entry.content:
This removes the IPH (primarily added in crrev.com/c/4348484), that

directed users to manage their downloads in the new download bubble.

This is no longer needed now that the download bubble has been

launched for several milestones, and it is getting in the way of

manual testing for other IPH promos displayed from the download

toolbar button.



This CL removes:

* Feature and configs associated with the IPH.

* Strings and translation screenshots used in the IPH.

* The profile pref that used to indicate whether it should be shown.

* Hooks in DownloadBubbleUIController to log the trigger condition.

* Tests referring to the IPH behavior.

entry.title: [realbox][cr23] Fix hover fill shape for non-inlined action matches.
entry.content:
This change introduces a new div that is only triggered when

OmniboxActionsUISimplification is disabled, chrome refresh hover fill

shape is on, and when a match has an action associated with it. The

underneath action chip is moved to inside this div so the hover shape

can sorround the entire match. In every other case, this div is hidden.

This will make it easy to clean up once OmniboxActionsUISimplification

is launched since this is the only case where the bug is triggered.



To test, disable #omnibox-actions-ui-simplification and enable

#ntp-realbox-cr23-expanded-state-icons,

#ntp-realbox-cr23-expanded-state-layout,

#ntp-realbox-cr23-hover-fill-shape.



Before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/cbsShcqYAjQPkzN

After: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/74zSZUAEL6smhg6



Bug: 1515956

entry.title: [A11y] Avoid redundant calls to SetNeedsToUpdateChildren()
entry.content:
Avoid triggering a SANITIZER_CHECK() when calling SetNeedsToUpdateChildren() on the included ancestor (inclusive).

The SANITIZER_CHECK prevents SetNeedsToUpdateChildren() from being

called while already in the middle of adding children. In that case,

the children_dirty_ bit is still set, because it is not cleared until all children have been added.



Therefore, to avoid this check, we can just check to see if the

children on the included ancestor are already dirty, and if so,

avoid calling SetNeedsToUpdateChildren() on the ancestor.



A repro case for the fixed crash occurs via the test failures in

patchset 101 of CL:4574033

(https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4574033/82?checksPatchset=101&tab=checks). That CL creates the conditions for

this bug to occur, and this change is necessary in order to fix

those failures, as well as instances of this check in the wild

(bug 1515845).



Fixed: 1515845

Change-Id: I27289937513f9dcc6c377c517d212e61459fb2c7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5173729

Reviewed-by: Chris Harrelson

Auto-Submit: Aaron Leventhal

entry.title: Revert "Write did-run to registry asynchronously."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 74344b22ad439a57f6f99453c83b9b9ed59813d8.



Reason for revert: DCHECK on startup; see notes in bug



Original change's description:

> Write did-run to registry asynchronously.

>

> My understanding is that generally we allow registry writes on the main

> sequence. However, they can take time if some other application is

> calling RegFlushKey (which blocks modifications to the entire hive), or

> something else is affecting registry write performance on the machines.

>

> Since neither the sequencing nor outcome of recording did-run is

> relevant to the callers, making the operation non-blocking seems easy

> enough.

>

> Fixed: 1509160

> Change-Id: I3d760bbe13c2b6427705c02524441c1ea0ce87b1

entry.title: Fenced frames: Make same-origin fenced frame redaction check consistent
entry.content:
Fix at least one potential cause of a BadMessage where renderer's view

of "same-origin to mapped url" and browser's view of "same-origin to

mapped url" differ.



The origin to be committed is not necessarily the origin of the url to

be committed, e.g. for sandboxed iframes. All our browser-side checks

are with respect to the last committed origin, so we should use the

origin to be committed when redacting fenced frame properties for the

renderer.



Bug: 1515202, 1508030

entry.title: Correctly handle a zero value for X25519 deriveBits' length parameter
entry.content:
The Secure Curves spec draft states that we should trunk the derived

bits based on any non-null value passed in the length parameter. Our

currently implementation has been considering zero like null, so we

are returning the entire derived bits array.



The bug 1433707 mentions on ongoing discussion related to the lack of

interoperability on the handling of the deriveBits' length parameter

in several algorithms, being the X25519 one of them. The proposed

change in the spec could be backward-incompatible, so we need time to

evaluate the impact on Chrome's implementation.



While the mentioned spec change discussion continues, this CL fixes a bug in our implementation that considered zero as null. With this change zero will return an empty vector, which matches the current spec.



Bug: 1433707

Change-Id: Ifbf5829db04bbc7c9ff916d27b586feae345b536

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5013612

entry.title: Fix OverlayProcessorWebview::Manager life-time
entry.content:
Class is created on RenderThread and we guarantee that it will be alive

until display compositor is destroyed, but UpdateOverlayBuffer is run

on GpuMain and can be posted while OverlayProcessor is alive but run

right after it's destroyed.



Manager can already outlive OverlayProcessor due to pending callbacks

and can be destroyed on both threads, so we can just extend life-time

for the duration of UpdateOverlayBuffer.



Bug: 1515741

entry.title: [Hub] Remove the pane's view when the PaneMediator is destroyed
entry.content:
On ToT returning to the Hub after loading a pane throws an exception

because the attached pane's parent is not removed when the mediator is

destroyed. Fix this by removing the pane on destroy so it no longer has

a parent.



This does have performance considerations due to needing to layout and

measure again, but showing the hub requires a layout pass anyway so we

probably aren't creating that much work by removing the pane's view.



We can look to optimize this if we change the HubCoordinator lifetime;

presently, closing the Hub destroys the HubCoordinator.



Bug: 1496708

Change-Id: Ia67e4fa81bb45c6ef459f9e6f77705d3cce8618d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5178017

Reviewed-by: Sky Malice

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

entry.title: [Signin][Android] Wait for prefs write before sign-in completion
entry.content:
For sign-in to be truly completed, the primary account must be

written in native preferences on the disk. However, the sign-in

completion callback was called without waiting for the pref writing

to be done.



One direct consequence is that, during Chrome restore, if the restore

ends after the sign-in completion call, the restore exits without

before the native prefs are written to the disk, and Chrome remains

signed-out after the restore.



This CL makes sure that the completion callback is called after the

prefs writing.



Bug: 1493706, 1513177

Change-Id: I61724fa0b5c1121ef9adada32aea78e024350d66

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5139786

entry.title: Revert "Enable screenshots for Incognito tabs"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9ff754070a9e2a9eebb024c8c8f908843bd60aad.



Reason for revert: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1B_KCSgx2q5QIc5-PtrYwwfaNQQe4mkGfnIXgBDI_l9w/



Original change's description:

> Enable screenshots for Incognito tabs

>

> Before this CL, all screenshots in incognito were disabled whether they were initiated in recents screen or when Chrome is in foreground. The only way for users to enable screenshots is to manually enable the kIncognitoScreenshot flag, which enables all screenshots without privacy considerations.

>

> This CL uses the new API introduced in Android T setRecentsScreenshotEnabled to disable screenshots in recents screen while enabling them in other contexts on Incognito.

>

> Demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BA2pVgxxyXPqa6hSXqPsRKt56QgZbuER/

entry.title: Write did-run to registry asynchronously.
entry.content:
My understanding is that generally we allow registry writes on the main

sequence. However, they can take time if some other application is

calling RegFlushKey (which blocks modifications to the entire hive), or

something else is affecting registry write performance on the machines.



Since neither the sequencing nor outcome of recording did-run is

relevant to the callers, making the operation non-blocking seems easy

enough.



Fixed: 1509160

entry.title: [ios] Avoid crashing if initialising the Browser is delayed
entry.content:
MainController may delay the initialisation of the Browser object (e.g.

when migrating the session storage from legacy to optimised format). If

this happens, it is possible for some SceneState to transition to the

SceneActivationLevelForegroundActive while no Browser exists.



To avoid a crash in SearchEngineChoiceCoordinator, check that the app

is ready (i.e. reached the InitStageFirstRun or higher) before deciding

to instantiate or not a SearchEngineChoiceCoordinator. To achieve this,

ignore any activation event before the app reach InitStageFirstRun, and

when it is reached, call `-maybeShowChoiceScreen:` for each SceneState

that is ready.



Bug: 1383087

entry.title: Align enums.xml with content_settings_uma_util.cc
entry.content:
Content settings 111 and 112 were added to content_settings_uma_util.cc,

but not to enums.xml. As a result, the recently added settings 113 and

114 were accidentally marked in enums.xml as 111 and 112.



As a result, the "Smart Card data" histogram bucket (currently marked

as 111) receives data from the Captured Surface Control setting (actual

111), and the "Web Printing" histogram bucket (currently marked as 112)

receives data from the Smart Card Guard setting (actual 112).



This CL aligns the numbering in the two files.

entry.title: [Printing] Do not update notification timeouts
entry.content:
Prior to https://crrev.com/c/2626111 notifications used to display

"Cancel Printing" and "Get Help" buttons, so never_timeout = true

ensured that they could always be clicked. Since this is no longer the

case and given that notifications are created with never_timeout = false

by default (see RichNotificationData), it's no longer necessary to

toggle timeouts.

entry.title: [bfcache] Make unload a blocklisted feature to capture location
entry.content:
This CL adds a new BFCache blocklisted reason "kUnloadHandler". The purpose of this is to use existing functions that capture the source location of blocklisted features for unload handlers. It does not affect the ongoing analysis of unload handler usage because it keeps the original reasons "kUnloadExistsInMain/SubFrame" as they are, and reports the new reason separately.

entry.title: Introduce a flag for whether tests are running in AOSP
entry.content:
In order to turn off Fallback CronetEngine tests in AOSP without increasing the divergence further,

Introduce a new control flag that is part of the APK resources, this can be controlled as we have different

resources for AOSP & Chromium. This resource file will have a boolean which the test runner can read to determine

whether the tests are running in AOSP or Chromium and act accordingly, this can be used to disable Fallback Cronet tests

and implement conditionals(eg: only run this piece of code for Chromium but not AOSP).



Bug: 311373434

entry.title: [Code Health] Clean up gin function templates on isolate disposal
entry.content:
gin previously relied exclusively on garbage collection in order to

trigger cleanup of function templates. This is unreliable as garbage

collection is never guaranteed to run, especially for short-lived

isolates.



This change adds observers for isolate disposal in order to clean up

function templates once an isolate is disposed.



A few (possibly non-exhaustive) leaked dangling pointers are fixed

with this change.



Bug: 1462087

AX-Relnotes: n/a

Change-Id: I2462de9cfb9622c03bc047b4cd727c6bf3cd3b11

entry.title: Align Encoded Transforms for Receiver Video frames to a metronome
entry.content:
Add metronome alignment for JS transforms of WebRTC Video frames

received over the network, behind a feature. This is hoped to help power

consumption for large calls, with many remote video streams which

need transforming, by reducing the number of JS thread wakeups.



Alignment for transforms of sent video and audio may be added later.

entry.title: SyncToSigninMigration: Add tests for custom passphrase cases
entry.content:
If a custom passphrase is in use: The migration should happen exactly

the same as without a passphrase.



If a custom passphrase is set up, but is missing (-> Sync is in an

encryption error state): The main migration (to non-syncing) should

still happen, but any existing data should remain local (not be moved

to the account store).

entry.title: [Sync] Generate a new key pair if local is corrupted
entry.content:
This CL changes the pre-existing behavior in case of a corrupted key

pair in Nigori local state. Rather than dropping the local state, a new

key pair is generated and replaces pre-existing key pair. The new key

pair will be committed to the server, and other clients are supposed to

replace their keys with the new value (this behavior is similar to just-upgraded clients).



Note that there shouldn't be a ping-pong issue, but for the safety the

key pair is checked only on browser startup. This approach also covers

the case if the key pair is corrupted on the server (but requires

browser restart).



Bug: 1511180

Change-Id: I9bb2f9491ff53a564a1038558d58ce462ab7ebe1
